About Us FREE GROUND SHIPPING ON ORDERS OVER $75 phone: +1 (702) 983-7931 Toggle menu my account Sign in Register Gift Certificates Search Search USD US Dollar Canadian Dollar Cart Search Home Sets Mens Right Hand Sets Mens Left Hand Sets Ladies Sets Clubs Drivers Fairway Woods Hybrids & Driving Irons Irons Wedges Putters Juniors Bags Carts Accessories Heads Only Home Sets Mens Right Hand Sets Mens Left Hand Sets Ladies Sets Clubs Drivers Fairway Woods Hybrids & Driving Irons Irons Wedges Putters Juniors Bags Carts Accessories Heads Only USD US Dollar Canadian Dollar Sign in or Register Gift Certificates Home About Us About Us We can trace our roots all the way back to 1829, with the founders of the company, a pair of English immigrants and expert woodworkers, opening a factory in Dayton OH. The company initially started as a producer of hand carved wooden shoe lasts, pioneering a new lathe-based technique for producing lasts faster and more accurately than anyone around. From 1875 to 1897, the company began a transformation. Two new partners were brough on; John McGregor, an expat from St Andrews, Scotland and a die-hard golfer, as well as Edward Canby, who soon became obsessed with the game. In 1897, the partnership began the manufacture of traditional golf shafts and clubs, one of America's very first club manufacturers. MacGregor clubs proved popular with both professionals and amateurs alike, with hundreds of thousands of clubs being sold around the world. The company emerged from the Great Depression with new ownership and management, who sought the services of the legendary Tommy Armour, who in turn brought his assistant Toney Penna, and tour pros Jimmy Demaret, Byron Nelson and Ben Hogan. This was a formidable team; during the 1950s, MacGregor was the number one club and ball on tour. A period of innovation and growth followed which led the company to its most iconic partnership with Jack Nicklaus. Besides dominating on the course, Mr Nicklaus was heavily involved with the management and direction of the company, and even ended up owning the company and bringing stability after a period of mismanagement. Since conception, MacGregor clubs have been used to win an incredible 59 majors in the hands and bags of all time greats like Jack Nicklaus and Greg Norman. Now, though our pedigree runs nearly two centuries, our approach is thoroughly modern. Uncompromising quality shipped direct to the consumer for simply unbeatable prices. We're here to put the MacGregor back on the map, and truly make it The Greatest Name in Golf once more. × OK Home International Returns Warranty FAQs about us contact us Privacy Policy Terms & Conditions Shipping & Returns Sign up for the latest news and offers Email Address 16 Sunset Way #110, Henderson, NV 89014 +1 (702) 983-7931 help@macgregorgolf.com © 2025 MacGregor Golf

Gregor MacGregor's Menu Visit Events Gallery Gift Cards Menu Visit Events Gallery Gift Cards Scroll Gregor MacGregor’s Mini Links & Drinks combines some of Florida’s favorite pastimes: a round of golf, a tasty drink, and beautiful scenery in the heart of historic Fernandina Beach. Enjoy our lush garden putt-putt course, beachy bar, and cool, comfy patio to enjoy with friends. Stop by on your next visit to Fernandina Beach! (That means a rootin’ good time) Woman playing mini gold Shot glass with lemon and pretzel behind About our namesake Just who is Gregor MacGregor? He was quite the scalawag. Read more about our infamous namesake. Old Portrait of Gregor MacGregor ... score and some-odd years ago, a Scottish adventurer named Gregor MacGregor landed in the beach and laid claim to Amelia Island to fly the green flag of the Republic of the Floridas. Thankfully, no inhabitants were kilt in the coup. MacGregor may have putt Amelia under Scottish rule in 1817, but he sure didn’t take it the fairway! MacGregor’s brazen conquest turned out to be a load of haggis before the year’s end and Amelia was soon passed to other victors, but MacGregor became an infamous part of our local history. Today, we chuckle at the memory of this scoundrel Scotsman ; and we welcome you to Fernandina’s newest golf club, Gregor MacGregor’s Mini Links & Drinks. We your whistle after an afternoon of golf!
